pr_title: CB-10162 Add log message every time the FreeIPA status is checked

timeline.message:
CB-10162 Add log message every time the FreeIPA status is checked

During ENGESC-5655, we had a hard time debugging the freeipa status. Currently we only log freeipa status when there is a transition (eg. from healthy to unreachable) and it was determined that adding a log message for both freeipa status and instance status during health check would be helpful. Now we added logging for every health check.

timeline.bodyText: I think the old way of looping outside of the updateInstanceStatus() was cleaner.
timeline.author: jamisonbennett

replies.bodyText: Thanks! I changed back to the old way of looping outside now and kept the method signature.
replies.author: christmasferret

timeline.bodyText: I am not sure what log level we should have for this. If debug output is enabled in prod, then it probably should be debug level.
timeline.author: jamisonbennett

replies.bodyText: Thanks! I changed to debug level.
replies.author: christmasferret

timeline.bodyText:
for this to work right I think you have to fetch stack or stack status from db or you would have to modify StackStatusCheckerJob#updateStackStatus to return the modified stack and use that.
You could use StackStatusService#findFirstByStackIdOrderByCreatedDesc to fetch the current status.
Also resource crn logging shouldn't be necessary, the MDCContext should have all the filed set.
timeline.author: lacikaaa

replies.bodyText: Thanks! I added StackStatusService.java and StackStatusRepository.java just like those in cloudbreak-core for datalake stack. Currently we don't have StackStatusService for freeipa but it is just the same as datalake stack. Now I use findFirstByStackIdOrderByCreatedDesc to fetch stack status. Also now CRN is removed as it is already logged by MDC.
replies.author: christmasferret

timeline.author: lacikaaa

replies.bodyText: Thanks a lot! I refactored and also added the fix for stack status.

timeline.bodyText: I think it might be saved via stack but I'm not sure. If you seen a missing status maybe it's best to save it here, but please test around with a few changes, even with HA when only one instance's status change to see if there is no issue. thanks
timeline.author: lacikaaa

replies.bodyText: Yes. My mistake. You are right. it is already saved via stack by cascading. The original code is working as it is. I confirmed in database and by debugging mode. I removed my change and kept it as before.
